main_definition: Sustainable refers to practices, methods or systems that can be maintained over the long term without depleting resources or causing harm to the environment.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Achievement of goals over a prolonged period
meanings_and_examples.example: The company's sustainable growth strategy focuses on increasing profits while maintaining ethical business practices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Ability to endure or withstand pressures, challenges and change without losing effectiveness
meanings_and_examples.example: Sustainable farming methods can withstand weather changes and continue producing crops year-round.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A lifestyle that meets the needs of the present generation without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs
meanings_and_examples.example: Sustainable living involves using resources wisely, reducing waste and minimizing environmental impacts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Practices or methods that do not deplete natural resources or cause long-term damage to the environment
meanings_and_examples.example: A sustainable diet includes eating more plant-based foods, reducing meat consumption and choosing locally sourced produce.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Long-lasting success achieved through continuous improvement and adaptation over time
meanings_and_examples.example: Sustainable business models focus on innovation, customer satisfaction and long-term profitability.
